Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of drinking water and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar in eliminating the coronavirus.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that there is no remedy yet to prevent or treat the disease.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough scientific evidence or support to prove its effectiveness.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that drinking water and gargling can eliminate the coronavirus without providing any scientific basis.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides alternative explanations and evidence that contradict the claim, stating that drinking water and gargling have not been identified as effective against the coronavirus.
